description.narrative:
Statistics Sweden (SCB) have applied for a total of 19 122 000 SEK in order to implement "Regional Cooperation Project in South Eastern Europe" (Albania, Bosnien & Herzegovina, Kosovo, Macedonia, Montenegro och Serbia) during 2019-2023. This is the fourth and final phase in the cooperation between SCB and the respective national statistical institutes.
The development objective of this fourth project phase are well developed stastitical systems in the region in line with the EU acquis for stastics. The project objective is that the National Statistical Institutes (NSIs) of the region actively engage each other regarding support and transfer of know-how with reference to more efficient statistical production and adaptation ot EU standards and acquis.
The component objectives are:
1) The NSIs are able to produce statistics more efficiently by using administrative date, with retained or improved quality 2) The NSIs are jointly able to supply each other with training and support, consistent with EU standards and EU acquis. 3) The Summer School institutionalised and fully owned by the NSIs in the region.
By contributing to the strengthening and institutionalisation of the cooperation between the national statistic authorities in the region the capacity building provided in previous project phases is expected to be strengthened and as such contributes to the long term sustainability of good standards for respective countries statistics.

Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) har sökt om medel om totalt 19 122 000 SEK för att genomföra "Regional Cooperation Project in South Eastern Europe" (Albanien, Bosnien & Herzegovina, Kosovo, Macedonien, Montenegro och Serbien) under perioden 2019-2023. Denna insats omfattar en fjärde och sista fas i samarbetet.
Syftet med insatsen är att utveckla statistiska system i regionen i linje med EUs acquis för statistik. Insatsens syftar till att de nationella statistikmyndigheterna i respektive samarbetsland i regionen aktivt engagerar och stödjer varandra samt bidrar till gemensam kapacitetsutveckling, delar med sig av varandras kunskap och erfarenheter om att utveckla statistik och anpassning till EUs standards och acquis.
I insatsens komponenter ingår: 1) Att de nationella statistik myndigheterna producerar statistik mer effektivt genom att använda administrativ data, med bibehållen och förbättrad kvalite; 2) Att de nationella statistik myndigheterna gemensamt bidrar till utbildningar och stöd till varandra, i enlighet med EUs standards och EUs acquis; 3) Att sommarskolorna institutionaliseras och fullt ut ägs av de nationella statistik myndigheterna i regionen.
Genom att bidra till att stärka och institutionalisera samarbetet mellan de nationella statistik myndigheterna i regionen väntas den kapacitetsutvecklingen som ingått i tidigare faser stärkas och skapa bättre förutsättningar för långsiktig hållbarhet vad gäller god standard för respektive lands statistik.

The project includes the following component objectives: 1. The national statistical institutes are able to produce statistics more efficiently by using administrative data, with retained or improved quality. 2. The national statistical institutes are jointly able to supply each other with training and support, consistent with EU standards and EU acquis. 3. The Summer School institutionalised and fully owned by the national statistical institutes in the region. The project will include administrative data and registers; survery methodology; and summer schools.

title.narrative: Service Purchase Arrangement between Sida and Statictics Sweden regarding Regional Cooperation Project South Eastern Europe 2019-2023
Regional Cooperation Project South Eastern Europe 2019-2023

description.narrative: The project "Regional Cooperation Project in South Eastern Europe - 2019-2023" is the fourth and final phase of a cooperation between Statistics Sweden (SCB) and the national statistics institutes in the EU canidate and potential candidate countries of Western Balkans namely Albania; Macedonia; Montenegro; Serbia; Kosovo; and Bosnia and Herzegovina. This final phase continues to aim for well-developed statistical systems in the region in line with the EU acquis for statistics. Additionally, to contribute to long term sustainability by enhancing the national statistical institutes of the region to actively engage each other regarding support and transfer of know-how regarding a more efficient statistical production and adaptation to EU standards and acquis. The current budget is 13 517 000 SEK. Some results reported per component Administrative Registers Component Three activities within the component were conducted during the reporting period: a planning meeting in May 2019, a seminar on the register-based censuses in November 2019 and a regional conference on the use of administrative data in December 2019. The conference had participants from statistical authorities and authorities with administrative data. Experiences of using various administrative data sources in different statistical areas were shared and new potential registers data were discussed. Survey Methodology ComponentA three-week course on Survey Methodology took place in the period June – October 2019 engaging two local expert and one Swedish expert. Twenty-five inexperienced statisticians trained in survey methodology and encouraged to share the knowledge with their counterparts at home and in the region. After the course, 79 per cent of the participants expressed that they would be able to use the acquired knowledge in their everyday work. All participants expressed that they would be able to improve the quality in any survey they work with. This contributes to one of the component objectives. Having local experts participating as lecturers on the courses, together with expert from SCB, represents a contribution towards the component objective "The NSIs are jointly able to supply each other with training and support, in accordance with EU standards and the EU acquis". Summer School Component The late project start (the project officially started in March 2019, but the first activity took place in May 2019) primarily affected the results under this component. Due to the short period from project outset until September, when the School usually takes place, the Summer School 2019 had to be cancelled. Instead the Regional Statistics Committee (RSC) decided to arrange a workshop on Farm Structure Survey to be conducted in early March 2020. It was however canceled based on Eurostat's decision to cancel all meetings due to the Covid-19 pandemic. SCB are now thinking about conducting the workshop online instead.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
